title: @RiotRepertoir please keep it up
body:
Repertoir's been really active recently and it is nice to have him communicate a lot with the boards, and I saw he also went on some streams (well at least Cowsep's (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XO21QlBcA20) to discuss to mains about the state of champions.

It is extremely nice to see a real communication being established with the community to discuss balance, and it would be sad to see it go.

What I mean, is that already happened a few years ago (two, three years?). Repertoir was there on gameplay answering pretty much everything and doing insane work.
If you don't believe me, there's some old threads even talking about it (sadly i can't see the number of upvotes anymore, but it was above 100, maybe even 200) : https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/A55xNotP-i-think-we-should-nerf-repertoir

Now I understand he can't be a literal god 24/7, but at least keeping a bit of contact with the community and not disappear like before to reappear a few years later would be great x)

Anyway... Thank you, keep it up !

replies.body:
He's not the only one, Maple nectar and jinxylord also do this

the ones who need to learn from that are recklessabandon and fearless

I'd say there are more on the team who could communicate better (CertainlyT, for example, I don't think communicates at all, and Cactopus I think has had times where he's flat-out done more harm than good), but I fully agree that there are also several Rioters who are doing a great job already, including many more than the ones cited above, and who deserve to be commended.

Personally, my problem with Riot's communications in recent times is that, oftentimes, Riot's idea of communication has come down to talking _at_ the players, rather than _with_ them. We get neatly wrapped dev blogs and occasional video clips where a Rioter basically monologues the whole time, or talks only with other Rioters, and once those things are posted, no comment given on those spaces really generates further official discussion. Even on Meddler's Quick Gameplay Thoughts, where he engages in the comments, player concerns may get a response, but practically never influence the actual development process. In general, the whole procedure feels set in stone, so we're only learning about what will happen, instead of being able to impact on that.

This is where RiotRepertoir's recent posts come in, because even though the broad lines of certain projects are fixed, players on the Boards are being proactively asked by the developers for feedback and suggestions, which have a genuine chance of affecting the final product. Jinxylord did this with the Rengar revert, which is why it turned out so successful. Because we are being invited to participate in the development process, rather than just told of a feature after all of the decisions have been made, we as a community feel empowered, and are therefore much more disposed to give constructive feedback. Because we are also being placed on an equal, mutually beneficial relationship with the development team, that relationship also translates to mutual respect for most players who participate, which in turns generates much better appreciation for Riot. Because we also have to grapple with the inherent difficulty in coming up with a workable solution to a problem, and even identifying and defining problems in the first place, we also get to appreciate the work Riot does much more, and are therefore less likely to dismiss Rioters and their work.

If there is one criticism I have of this, it's that so far this kind of enriching, two-way discussion has only been sporadic, when in practice it should be happening all the time. So far, we only get this kind of communication from some Rioters, who only get to do so when they're not knee-deep in other work. As such, while things are going really well now, they may be much less likely to do the same once Repertoir or Jinxylord have to pull back due to other commitments. In this respect, Riot really needs to work on making this kind of communications a proper, fully-fledged system, one where Rioters are scheduled to communicate with players and invite them on design work on a regular basis, rotating as some members of the team enter or leave other important projects in order to render these communications consistent. I feel we're already experiencing significantly positive returns from this current bout of good communications, and continuing on this good trend could permanently change League, the Boards and the entire player community for the better.

Friendly plug for Playtest's patch chat. It occurs every Wednesday after a new patch in the Dev Corner, and we have a good amount more free time than game designers to discuss things, and also bring up player concerns to designers. I brought up Ahri with Live Gameplay as a result of hearing constant player pains there, as well as Zyra solo laning changes a while back.
The playtest crew is actually pretty sweet.

Related to OP's post, I did a [short write-up](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/wOJ6hIxr-repertoir-so-i-heard-you-want-master-yi-to-channel-meditate) answering questions about Meditate you had.
I'm still very grateful for you sticking around the Quinn mains streams I put on when Quinn was going through her rework. Stay awesome ^-^
Can we get a link to where this is? Or even a pinned thread with it in the Gameplay section would be neat! Literally never knew bout this.

It's in the Dev Corner! :D
https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/uHtUVgXK-patch-chat-with-the-playtest-team-85
How do you feel between the two sets of Ahri changes. Personally, I'm vehemently against the R changes and would rather go for the set of changes with the E amp.

I disliked the Xerath R model for Ahri R personally, as I don't believe her playerbase really wants a "farm to 16 in a side lane" type of playstyle (as by that point in the game I typically feel like I'm kinda weak as Ahri, and sending that message to players that their most epic moment comes at 16 felt off to me on a character who I believe to want to skirmish/snowball)

I vastly preferred the first set of changes, and am pretty happy with the latest list Rick tweeted out.

I really agree with you. The 2nd set of changes really push her into this teamfighting, divey sort of champion and I think would lead her into a lot more tankier build and becoming a battle mage similar to Vlad or Ryze, rather than a squishy burster/kiter that she was intended to be. Not to mention, the changes would really tank her 1v1 potential.

Just saw the new list and I think it's great, if not overtuned. I'm not sure she needs to gain 5% AP total since she's getting the E amp and the R CDR per hit even if she's losing 80 base damage between E and R. I'd personally go with either +10% on W or +5% per R charge, but then again I'd rather under tune her than over tune her for the time being considering how controversial she can be.

I'm not really an ahri main anymore but I really loved the R changes. I think that the changes for r do a much better job of giving her a punishment for using it defensively. It also enables you too charm more in a fight meaning you can just have more impact.
You all don’t get enough credit for doing those chats - thank you!

I just know that it was disproved in the past on the boards by Rioters, CT did in fact give some advice or input to the creator of Zed but he is not in fact Zed's designer. Eventually you'll get informed correctly whether by a Rioter or by other people that will verify this.

If that's his work then, well, actually, he should have job.

Sure, people may hate a lot of those champions... but that's because they're so _popular_. Like, really, really popular.

Darius is a fun top lane.

Thresh is an amazing support, probably one of the best all-around high-skill-high-return supports.

Zyra's kinda a mixed bag, but she can be a fun support. 

Yasuo is heavily hated, sure, but he's also HIGHLY played. I've almost never played him, but, man, he's sure fun to watch be played perfectly. Just, objectively, he's got a lot of potential for those very-high-skill-cap plays which make top elo fun. 

Kalista is a very interesting adc. She's hard to balance and out of the meta right now, but, she's interesting, I appreciate the niche.

Zed is all the same comments as Yasuo.

Warwick (was T involved in the rework?) because rework WW is in a great space imo. He's maybe a little too strong right now, but I really appreciate thematically and technically where he fits.

Other than that though, yeah the communication is fantastic.

I enjoy interacting with reds, Shout out to Cobra for being a chill dude.  Unrelated, I do find that I miss Iron stylus sometimes.  Anyhow yea nice to see them interacting with boards, I really hope their effort to communicate makes boards a less toxic environment but eh its an online community.
